column2: This evil cult worships the extra-dimensional malevolent entity known as Gaston. The Cult of Gaston is poised to take over the multiverse and make anime real.
Large groups of the common folk in [This.GetName] are worshipping within a ancient temple of the Druze faith. Some claim that it is the way to understanding God and the Universe themselves.
A surge of popularity of the Druze faith is underway in this province.
Let the peasants have their faith.
Your agents report that bands of Druzi have been spotted in [Root.GetName], attempting to spread their faith. Their zealotry appears to spring from the Druze Revival in [From.GetName].
Expel the infidels from my lands with martial force.
Drive the infidels out, in the name of [Root.Holder.Religion.GetRandomGodName].

At the Druze Revival in [Root.GetName] you bear witness to the true esoteric mysteries of the world. You can feel your curiosity even now... racing as you wish to understand the Universe and so God. The evil spirits of this world seek hide these secrets for themselves, but with study and persistence you can defeat them.
If you are a vassal, your liege will react\n\n
I will not turn away from my faith!
I will nip this heresy in the bud!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to you with zealous Druze fervor in [From.GetPossPronoun] eyes. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] attempts to convert you, claiming that [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] is simply a manifestation of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s power.
I will not turn away from my faith!
I will convince [From.GetObjectPronoun] to return to the fold..

You have abandoned your old religious practices, and embraced the awesome knowledge of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. Will this lead you to power and glory, or see you fall into ruin at the hands of hostile infidels?

Your Druze zeal seems to have swayed the mind of your liege. [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided it would be wise to abandon [From.GetPossPronoun] old faith and join you in dedicating [From.GetPossPronoun] life to understanding the esoteric mysteries of the world.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has not taken kindly to your Druze conversion. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] sees you as a misguided infidel, rather than as a prophet revealing the truth about [This.Religion.GetRandomGodName].

[Root.Holder.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from the Druze Revival in [From.From.GetName]. [From.GetPossPronounCap] theological skill has allowed him to resist the allure of the Druze, and swiftly put an end to the heresy.

[Root.Holder.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from the Druze Revival in [From.From.GetName], having resisted the seductive power of the Druze. Unfortunately, the Druze agitation will take some time to die down.

The Druze is an esoteric religion originating in Western Asia who self-identify as Al-Muwahhidun, meaning the people of Monotheism. At odds with their Abrahamic brothers, Jethro of Midian is considered their spiritual founder and chief prophet. The religion is based on the teachings of Hamza ibn-'Ali ibn-Ahmad and the sixth Fatimid caliph Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah. Heavy Influence comes from Greek philosophers such as Plato, Aristotle, and Pythagoras. Christian figures like John the Baptist and Jesus Christ also play a large role as well defining the faith. The Druze religion believes after the end of the world they must go to China, unite and conquer the world from that point.

Yazidi is a monotheistic religion that has roots in a western Iranic pre-Zoroastrian religion directly derived from the Indo-Iranian tradition. It is followed by the mainly Kurmanji-speaking Yazidis and is based on belief in one God who created the world and entrusted it into the care of seven Holy Beings, known as Angels. Preeminent among these Angels is Tawuse Melek, who is the leader of the Angels and who has authority over the world. In the Yazidi myth of creation, Tawuse Melek refused to bow before Adam, the first human, when God ordered the Seven Angels to do so. The command was actually a test, meant to determine which of these angels was most loyal to God by not prostrating themselves to someone other than their creator. This belief has been linked by some people to the Islamic mythological narrative on Iblis, who also refused to prostrate to Adam, despite God's express command to do so. Because of this similarity to the Islamic tradition of Iblis, Muslims and followers of Abrahamic religions have erroneously associated and identified the Peacock Angel with their own conception of the unredeemed evil spirit Satan and or Shaytan, a misconception which has incited centuries of violent religious persecution of the Yazidis as "devil-worshippers"

Here the Marinsavu warriors traditionally from the Ryukuan Islands gather to train and share tales of their raids across Asia and east India
